file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 52-30-02-04 - BAGGAGE-DOOR RUBBER-TRIM SEAL - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL BAGGAGE-DOOR RUBBER-TRIM SEAL - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the baggage-door rubber-trim seal. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY BAGGAGE-DOOR RUBBER-TRIM SEAL - ALL 52-30-02-000-801-A REMOVAL BAGGAGE-DOOR RUBBER-TRIM SEAL - ALL 52-30-02-400-801-A INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 52-30-02 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-30-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. BAGGAGE-DOOR RUBBER-TRIM SEAL - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the baggage-door rubber-trim seal. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 52-00-04-300-801-A/800 RUBBER TRIM SEAL - REPAIR AMM TASK 52-30-01-000-801-A/400 BAGGAGE DOOR - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Plastic spatula To remove the Rubber Trim Seal available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On the baggage door I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Open the baggage door. (2) Remove the baggage door ( AMM TASK 52-30-01-000-801-A/400). (3) Put the baggage door on a safe surface to prevent damage. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Slowly and with a plastic spatula, release the rubber seal from the baggage door. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-30-02 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) If necessary, do a repair of the rubber trim seal ( AMM TASK 52-00-04-300-801-A/ 800). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-30-02 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Rubber Trim Seal - Removal/Installation Figure 401 D D A ZONE 813 C SEAL C B DET. A AREA TO BE MASKED OFF SECTION D-D ~ 3 mm SEAL 2 1 45˚ 2 DET. B ~ 5 mm 1 SEALANT RTV 157 2 0.2-0.5 mm THICKNESS SEAL LAYER OF RTV-157 SECTION C-C AREA TO BE MASKED OFF 145AMM520357.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-30-02 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-30-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. BAGGAGE-DOOR RUBBER-TRIM SEAL - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the baggage-door rubber-trim seal. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 52-30-01-400-801-A/400 BAGGAGE DOOR - INSTALLATION BAGGAGE-DOOR ACTUATING AND LOCKING AMM TASK 52-31-00-700-801-A/500 MECHANISM - OPERATIONAL TEST/ADJUSTMENT C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) RTV-157 Sealant AR TT-M-261 Methyl Ethyl Ketone (MEK) AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On the baggage door I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Remove old sealing compound with a spatula, as necessary. (2) NOTE: See the figure 401 (sections C-C and D-D) for dimensions of the area to be masked off. Limit the application area of the sealant by using masking tape on the surface edges to be sealed around the door. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-30-02 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL WARNING: USE SEALANT OR SOLVENT IN WELL VENTILATED AREAS. PREVENT VAPOR INHALATION AND LONG SKIN CONTACT WITH THESE PRODUCTS. (3) Clean the surface where the sealant will be applied, with a clean cloth soaked in solvent (MEK - Methyl Ethyl Ketone). (4) Rub a clean and dry cloth on the surface. (5) Apply a 0.2 to 0.5-mm thickness layer of RTV-157 on all baggage door contour when the seal will be sealed (refer to Figure 401 sections C-C and D-D). (6) With a plastic spatula, make the sealant layer constant. (7) Install the four seals on the baggage door. (8) Push your finger against the seal to install it correctly. (9) After all (four) seals are installed, remove the excess corners by cutting them at 45 degrees so that the chamfers thus formed match (refer to Figure 401, detail B). (10) Remove masking tapes from the door. (11) Apply RTV-157 between the end edge of the seals. NOTE: For a better finish of the sealant, you can soak your fingers in water-and-soap solution and pass them on the sealant that is applied. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A NOTE: • The aircraft can be dispatched 6 hours after the sealant application. • If the sealant is tack-free before 6 hours, the aircraft can be operated. • The tack-free time changes as a function of environmental conditions. (1) Carefully remove the baggage door from the support. (2) Install the baggage door ( AMM TASK 52-30-01-400-801-A/400). (3) If the handle is too tight, do the adjustment of the baggage door actuating and locking mechanism ( AMM TASK 52-31-00-700-801-A/500). (4) Close the baggage door.
